intro: Parameria griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's parameria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
